Post:
"I had a wake-up call today when I almost choked on my lunch. It made me realize how short and fragile life is, and how we should cherish every moment."

In this post, the individual attributes the cause of their near-death experience to the fragility of life. They imply that life is unpredictable and can change in an instant, which aligns with the definition of SAS as a chronic and stable attributional style. By acknowledging the fragility of life, the individual demonstrates a long-lasting explanation for the event, which fits the criteria for SAS.
